item.description:
If we get 3-6 inches of new snow, the conditions should be good for snowshoeing at Mine Falls Park on Sunday. We can do a loop for an hour or two (2-3 miles or so). It's relatively flat and close to home, if you live in the Nashua area. You will need to supply your own snowshoes.

The park is dog friendly, but dogs must be on a leash. I'll have my friendly black lab with me. She loves the snow.

NOTE: If it rains, instead of snows, we will reschedule for another time

About the Park

Mine Falls Park is a 325 acre park located near the heart of the City on the Nashua River. The name "Mine Falls" derives from the low quality lead which was mined from the islands below the Falls in the 1700s. A centerpiece of the park is the three-mile long, man-made canal built in the early 1800s to power the Nashua Mills. The park is great for hiking or biking and has 20 miles of multi-use trails that are on mostly level terrain.

Lincoln Park Entrance:

Exit 6 off Everett Turnpike/Route 3 in Nashua. Turn Right off of the exit. Turn onto Coliseum Drive, AFTER the Christmas Tree Shop/Kohl's shopping mall. The NH State Liquor store will be on your right in .25 miles. Follow Coliseum Dr. to the parking lot at end of road, past Hannaford's (approx. 1 mile from turn).
item.why: The forecast calls for 3-6 inches of new snow Saturday night
item.name: Snowshoe: Mine Falls Park
